required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Tolerability of Sifrol® (Pramipexole) in Patients With Advanced Idiopathic Parkinson's Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Observation of the Efficacy and Tolerability of Sifrol® (Pramipexole) in Patients With Advanced Idiopathic Parkinson's Disease

brief_summary.textblock: Assessment of daily maintenance dose of Sifrol®, L-dopa sparing effect, effect on tremor, depression, anhedonia and tolerability

primary_outcome.measure: Change in cumulative daily doses of Sifrol®
primary_outcome.description: Changes in the doses between visits are evaluated using Wilcoxon's signed rank test

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in cumulative daily doses of L-dopa
primary_outcome.description: Changes in the doses between visits are evaluated using Wilcoxon's signed rank test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Short Parkinson Evaluation Scale (SPES) total score
Change from Baseline in SPES subscales
secondary_outcome.description: Psychopathological disturbances, Activities of daily living, Evaluation of motor function, Tremor, Resting Tremor, Postural tremor, Complications of therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Snaith-Hamilton-Pleasure-Scale total score
Change from Baseline in Tremor Impact Scale (TIS-D) total score
Change from Baseline in global Parkinson's Disease (PD) symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Akinesia, anhedonia, depression, dyskinesia, motor fluctuation, cognitive disturbances, rigor and tremor

secondary_outcome.measure: Global assessment of efficacy by investigator on a 5-point scale
Global assessment of tolerability by investigator on a 5-point scale
Number of patients with adverse events
Number of patients with adverse drug reactions

study_pop.textblock: Patients with advanced idiopathic Parkinson's diease recruited at specialist practices and hospitals

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with advanced idiopathic Parkinson's disease for whom combined treatment with Sifrol and L-dopa was indicated
Exclusion Criteria:
